_description: Systematic extraction of council district GIS data from King County services

notes: Seattle City Council Districts - King County MapServer (primary). 7 districts (SCC1-SCC7). Voters approved district-based elections in 2013. 2022 redistricting based on 2020 census.
King County Council Districts - 9 districts covering entire county. Not city-level but useful for county-level analysis. Includes council member contact info. 2021 redistricting based on 2020 census.
Seven councilmembers elected at-large to staggered four-year terms. Council selects mayor from among members. No geographic districts - entire city votes for all positions.

Seven councilmembers elected at-large to four-year terms. 'Kent for Districts' campaign launched 2024 to petition for district-based elections but not yet implemented. Currently no geographic districts.
Seven councilmembers elected at-large to four-year terms in staggered elections. No geographic districts. Some advocacy for district-based model but not implemented.
Seven councilmembers elected at-large to staggered four-year terms. Changed from council-manager to mayor-council in 2009 referendum. No geographic districts.
Seven councilmembers elected at-large to numbered positions. Council-manager form with hired city manager. No geographic districts.
Seven councilmembers elected at-large to numbered positions on two-year cycles. Strong mayor form of government. No geographic districts.
Seven councilmembers elected at-large. Home to Microsoft headquarters. No geographic council districts found in GIS searches.
Seven councilmembers elected at-large. Incorporated in 1999. No geographic council districts found in GIS searches.
Seven councilmembers elected at-large. No geographic council districts found in GIS searches.

layersExplored.name: sccdst_area
layersExplored.note: Seattle City Council only - no other cities

layersExplored.name: citydst_area
layersExplored.note: City boundaries only, not council districts

conclusion: King County GIS services only contain Seattle City Council districts. All other major King County cities (Bellevue, Kent, Renton, Federal Way, Kirkland, Auburn, Redmond, Sammamish, Burien) use at-large council election systems and do not have geographic council districts to map. Seattle is the only city in King County with district-based council elections, as noted in local reporting.
